question: The first-ever World Pulses Day (WPD) is observed on which of the following dates?
explanation: The first-ever World Pulses Day (WPD) is observed on 10th February to raise awareness about the multiple benefits of eating  pulses. Pulses are a type of leguminous crop that are harvested solely for the dry seed. Dried beans, lentils and peas are the most commonly known and consumed types of pulses. Pulses do not include crops that are harvested green (e.g. green peas, green beans)—these are classified as vegetable crops. In 2018, the UN General Assembly (UNGA) designated 10 February as World Pulses Day (WPD) to keep alive the positive momentum surrounding these healthy, nutritious, protein-rich, nitrogen-fixing legumes after FAO\'s successful 2016 International Year of Pulses (IYP) Campaign.
